title: Labour MP Owen Smith resigns over ‘political and personal reasons’
text:
Labour MP Owen Smith made a failed bid to topple Jeremy Corbyn as Labour leader in 2016 (Picture: PA)

Former Labour leadership contender Owen Smith has announced that he will not be standing at the upcoming general election.

The MP for Pontypridd, Wales, said he was quitting due to ‘political and personal reasons’.

In a letter to Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn, he wrote: ‘I write to inform you that, for political and personal reasons, I will not be standing at the forthcoming General Election.

‘It has been an enormous privilege to serve as a Labour MP and I am truly proud to have represented my hometown of Pontypridd over the last decade.

Mr Smith has represented Pontypridd since 2010 (Picture: PA)

The letter sent by Labour MP for Pontypridd Owen Smith to Jeremy Corbyn (Picture: PA)

‘I would like to thank all those in the Labour Party and the wider community who have supported me.

‘I would also like all of my constituents to know that it has been a great honour for me to serve as their Member of Parliament.’

It comes after MPs voted for a December 12 election earlier this evening.

Labour MP, Pat McFadden, tweeted: ‘Owen Smith has been both a personal friend and a great servant of Labour and the people of Pontypridd for many years. He is a great loss to Labour and Parliament. I wish him all the very best for the future.’
